question: Welche der "Biene Maja" Illustrationen von Peter Christian Rasmussen sind Radierungen?
answer: "Die Wanze stinkt", "Empfang in Peppis Rosenhaus", "Überfall der Hornisse", "Majas Flucht", "Begegnung mit Aloys Siebenpunkt, Dichter seines Zeichens", "Im Spinnennetz", "Ich bin Kurt, aus der Familie der "Rosenkäfer"", "Begegnung mit dem Grashüpfer", "Schlacht der Bienen und Hornissen", "Lass doch bitte Hans Christoph frei!"
llm_final:
After examining the data, I can now provide you with information about which of Peter Christian Rasmussen's "Biene Maja" illustrations are radierungen (etchings).

FinalAnswer:

Based on the dataset from the Schleswig-Holsteinische Landesbibliothek - Landesgeschichtliche Sammlung, all ten of Peter Christian Rasmussen's "Biene Maja" illustrations are radierungen (etchings). These illustrations were created in 1920 as part of an artist portfolio with a limited edition of 100 copies (the dataset specifically shows copy number 66). 

The ten etchings in the collection are:
1. "Lass doch bitte Hans Christoph frei!" (Please let Hans Christoph free!)
2. "Begegnung mit dem Grashüpfer" (Encounter with the grasshopper)
3. "Ich bin Kurt, aus der Familie der Rosenkäfer" (I am Kurt, from the rose beetle family)
4. "Im Spinnennetz" (In the spider web)
5. "Begegnung mit Aloys Siebenpunkt, Dichter seines Zeichens" (Encounter with Aloys Siebenpunkt, poet by profession)
6. "Majas Flucht" (Maja's escape)
7. "Die Wanze stinkt" (The bug stinks)
8. "Empfang in Peppis Rosenhaus" (Reception in Peppi's rose house)
9. "Überfall der Hornisse" (Attack of the hornet)
10. "Schlacht der Bienen und Hornissen" (Battle of the bees and hornets)

All of these works were printed on handmade paper, signed by the artist, and created using the etching technique (Radierung), which is a form of intaglio printmaking. The descriptions note that the lettering was created using lithographic techniques.

Source: https://opendata.schleswig-holstein.de/dataset/1b8e98d2-08b1-4bd9-9be8-7cf2b477307e
